intro: Leptorkis thwaitesii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
